task_summary: The robot's end effector pours liquid from a cup into a mug positioned on a table.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base 6-DoF manipulator, equipped with a gripper holding a cup, pours its contents into a mug placed on the table. The main roles are arm manipulation for precise alignment and safe pouring. Constraints include collision avoidance, correct orientation over the mug, and a controlled pour angle (tilt). Visual feedback ensures accurate positioning throughout.
preconditions: Cup is grasped by robot end-effector
Mug is present and upright on table
No obstacles between robot and mug
stepwise_plan: Detect cup (if check required for cup presence)
Move above mug, with cup in gripper
Approach and align cup opening to mug
Pour from cup to mug by tilting around 90 degrees
Retract arm to a safe position
success_criteria: Cup is tilted over the mug
Liquid (or assumed contents) transferred into mug
failure_and_recovery: If mug not detected: scan and retry
If alignment fails: adjust and retry
If pour is incomplete: check pose and repeat pour action
task_long_description.termination: Sequence halts after pour and retreat actions; mug contains the contents from cup.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Locate the mug on the workspace using sensors.
Confirm the cup (source for pouring) is present in the gripper.
Raise and position the cup above the mug prior to pouring.
Approach and align the cup opening to be over the mug.
Tilt the cup to pour its contents into the mug.
Retract the arm away from the pour zone for safety.

failure_modes: Object detection failure (mug or cup not seen)
recovery_strategy: Re-align and retry pour if sensor feedback detects no liquid transfer
Retreat and pause to prevent spillage
assumptions: Frames do not show explicit verification of transfer, only the manipulation and pour motion
Cup is already grasped by the robot at episode start
No explicit gripper open/close is needed (no grasping/release steps here)
Pour parameters like amount/pour_rate are unknown; set to null
Instruction refers to 'the mug' but frames demonstrate source cup and target mug mapping

expected_success_criteria: Cup opening is aligned above the mug
Cup is tilted such that contents would pour into mug
Robot retreats after pouring without causing spillage
